level.heading: Short title.
level.text: This article shall be known and may be cited as Uniform Commercial Code-- Secured Transactions.

level.heading: Legislative History of Laws
level.text: Law 13-201, the "Uniform Commercial Code Secured Transactions Revision Act of 2000," was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 13-370, which was referred to the Committee on Finance and Revenue. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on June 6, 2000, and July 11, 2000, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on August 11, 2000, it was assigned Act No. 13-434 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review. D.C. Law 13-201 became effective on October 26, 2000.

level.heading: Effective Dates
level.text: Section 501 of D.C. Law 13-201 provides: "Except for section 301 (j) [amending ยง 28:9-402 by adding subsecs. (9) to (11)], this act shall shall apply as of July 1, 2001. Section 301 (j) shall take effect in accordance with section 601.
